title: Recognize the Standard Equation of Ellipses
text: The equation is in standard form, $$\frac{{\left(x-h\right)}^2}{a^2}+\frac{{\left(y-k\right)}^2}{b^2}=1$$. In the standard form, (h,k) is the center of ellipse. What is the center (h,k)? Enter your answer in the form (h,k).
speech: The equation is in standard form,  fraction, parentheses x minus h,  squared, over, a squared,  plus fraction, parentheses y minus k,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1 . In the standard form, (h,k) is the center of ellipse. What is the center (h,k)? Enter your answer in the form (h,k).

. In the standard form, (h,k) is the center of ellipse. What is the center (h,k)? Enter your answer in the form (h,k).

title: Find a and $$b$$ in $$\frac{{\left(x-h\right)}^2}{a^2}+\frac{{\left(y-k\right)}^2}{b^2}=1$$.
text: $$\frac{{\left(x-h\right)}^2}{a^2}+\frac{{\left(y-k\right)}^2}{b^2}=1$$ is the standard form of ellipse that is not centered at the origin. Given equation $$\frac{{\left(x+5\right)}^2}{36}+\frac{{\left(y-3\right)}^2}{16}=1$$, what is a?
speech: fraction, parentheses x minus h,  squared, over, a squared,  plus fraction, parentheses y minus k,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1  is the standard form of ellipse that is not centered at the origin. Given equation  fraction, parentheses x plus 5,  squared, over 36,  plus fraction, parentheses y minus 3,  squared, over 16,  is equal to 1 , what is a?
pacedSpeech: fraction,  x minus h,  squared, over, a squared,  plus fraction,  y minus k,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1
is the standard form of ellipse that is not centered at the origin. Given equation   fraction,  x plus 5,  squared, over 36,  plus fraction,  y minus 3,  squared, over 16,  is equal to 1

title: Find a and $$b$$ in $$\frac{{\left(x-h\right)}^2}{a^2}+\frac{{\left(y-k\right)}^2}{b^2}=1$$.
text: We know that $$a=6$$ and $$b=4$$ in the given equation. $$4<6$$, so the major axis is horizontal. The distance from the center to the vertices is $$6$$. The distance from the center to the endpoints of the minor axis is $$4$$. So this graph is the correct answer.\n##figure1.gif##
speech: We know that  a is equal to 6  and  b, is equal to 4  in the given equation.  4, is less than, 6 , so the major axis is horizontal. The distance from the center to the vertices is  6 . The distance from the center to the endpoints of the minor axis is  4 . So this graph is the correct answer.\n##figure1.gif##
